intro: Godetia amoena var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender godetia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, upright stems and produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink and white. Its foliage is characterized by lance-shaped, hairy leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
